GamerJunkdotNet May 6, 2012 at 3:17 am You can download a 3rd party app manager such as http://www.appbrain.com and uninstall it if you are having issues with the built in app manager. Susendeep Dutta May 3, 2012 at 6:29 am Go to Settings-->Applications-->Manage Applications and locate Twitter app and tap on it and select "clear data" to remove all data and "clear history" to clear all history from your phone and then tap on "uninstall" to finally uninstall the app.
